III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance with all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance with all additional MDHHS
Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not offered technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no incidents of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during this
licensing period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period.
The facility has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) not
related to maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted a CAP on December 5, 2019 for the Renewal Inspection that
was completed in November 2019. The CAP was approved on December 5, 2019.
The agency is in compliance with the December 2019 CAP, as the agency did not
receive a repeat violation during the current Interim Inspection.
During interviews, all youth reported feeling safe at the facility and feel staff treat them
well. Youth reported they participate in a variety of activities including indoor and
outdoor recreational activities, individual and group therapy and visitation with family
and/or mentors.
Staff reported House of Providence Girls’ administration is supportive of both staff
and the youth. They said the administration strives at ensuring the youth’s medical,
dental and mental health needs are always being met. Staff indicated they receive
ample training that has been very beneficial in assisting them in caring for the youth
1

who are in the program. Staff reported there are no suggestions on how the program
could improve.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility continue on their regular license.
